benchmark_details.name: CARL-GT
benchmark_details.overview: CARL-GT is a benchmark for evaluating Causal Reasoning capabilities of large Language Models using Graphs and Tabular data. It includes various tasks for causal graph reasoning, knowledge discovery, and decision-making.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure the capabilities of large language models in causal reasoning through diverse tasks involving causal graph reasoning, knowledge discovery, and decision making.

data.source: Generated causal graphs and corresponding tabular data based on structural causal models.
data.annotation: Automatically generated based on defined causal relationships.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the accuracy of predictions compared with ground-truth results for various causal reasoning tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in understanding and inferring causal relationships.
methodology.baseline_results: Results from multiple LLMs evaluated across various tasks.
methodology.validation: The benchmark tasks were validated to reflect real-world causal reasoning scenarios.
